feat.title: Aberrant Mark of Contagion
feat.benefit: Whenever you hit an enemy with a daily attack power, that enemy takes a -2 penalty to saving throws against ongoing damage until the end of the encounter.
You are immune to the negative effects of diseases from sources that are more than 5 levels lower than you, though you still carry and spread those diseases.

feat.title: Aberrant Mark of Madness
feat.benefit: Whenever you hit an enemy with a daily attack power, that enemy takes a -2 penalty to Will until the end of the encounter.
You are immune to the negative effects of madness from sources 5 levels lower than yourself.

feat.title: Aberrant Mark of Terror
feat.benefit: Whenever you hit an enemy with a daily attack power, that enemy takes a -1 penalty to attack rolls against you until the end of the encounter. This is a Fear effect.
You are immune to the negative effects of Fear and intimidation from sources 5 levels lower than yourself.

feat.title: Acolyte of Divine Secrets
feat.benefit: You gain training in the Religion skill.
Choose a 1st-level Invoker at-will attack power. You can use that power as an encounter power.
In addition, you gain proficiency in Invoker implements.

feat.title: Acolyte of the Veil
feat.benefit: You gain training in the Acrobatics or Stealth skill.
You can use shadow step as an encounter power.
In addition, you gain proficiency in ki focuses.

feat.title: Active Familiar
feat.benefit: When you take a move action, you can also move your familiar its speed or shift it 1 square.

feat.title: Advantageous Eye
feat.benefit: When you hit a target with your evil eye of the Vistani bloodline power, the target grants combat advantage to all your allies for the duration of the power.

feat.title: Against All Odds
feat.benefit: If, at the start of your turn, three or more enemies are adjacent to you, you gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls until the end of your turn.
The bonus to damage rolls increases to +2 at 11th level, and to +3 at 21st level.

feat.title: Aggressive Advantage
feat.benefit: You gain combat advantage against all enemies until the end of your first turn in each combat.

feat.title: Airspur Windrider
feat.benefit: You subtract 10 feet from the distance you fall before determining falling damage.
This increases to 20 feet subtracted at 21st level.

feat.title: Alchemical Opportunist
feat.benefit: If you have an alchemical item in hand when an enemy provokes an reactive strike from you, you can use that alchemical item instead of making a melee basic attack.

feat.title: Alchemical Scrounger
feat.benefit: When you miss all targets with an alchemical item, roll a d20. On a result of 10 or higher, you can recover the item as a short rest activity. You can only recover one item per day.
feat.special: If you take this feat as a paragon tier feat, you can recover two alchemical items each day. If you take it as an epic tier feat, you can recover three.

feat.title: Alchemist
feat.benefit: You can make alchemical items of your level or lower. You must have the correct formula and training in an appropriate skill.
You learn two formulas of your level or lower when you first take this feat.
feat.special: If you receive the Ritual Caster feat from a class feature, you can choose to gain this feat instead. If the feature grants you additional rituals known, you instead gain alchemical formulas at the same rate.

feat.title: Alertness
feat.benefit: You cannot be surprised.
Also, you gain a +2 feat bonus to Perception checks.

feat.title: Ancient Lore of the Dawn War
feat.benefit: You have studied the lore of old deities and the history of the Dawn War: you gain a +2 feat bonus to History and Religion checks, and you gain the Supernal language.

feat.title: Animal Empathy
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to Nature checks.
Also, when you would make an Insight check against a natural beast, you can make a Nature check instead.

feat.title: Arcane Dockhand
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 bonus to Acrobatics checks made to balance, and to Athletics checks made to climb.
Also, you master the ritual make whole and can perform it without a ritual book.

feat.title: Arcane Initiate
feat.benefit: You gain training in the Arcana skill.
Choose a 1st-level wizard at-will attack power. You can use that power as an encounter power.
In addition, you gain proficiency in Wizard implements.

feat.title: Arcane Porter
feat.benefit: Your familiar can pick up and carry an unattended object weighing 5 pounds or less.
It can hold only one object at a time.

feat.title: Arcane Prodigy
feat.benefit: You gain training in Arcana.
Once per encounter as a free action, you gain a +2 bonus to your next damage roll.
This bonus increases to +3 at 11th level, and +4 at 21st level.
In addition, you gain proficiency in Sorcerer implements.

feat.title: Argent Falcon
feat.benefit: You replace one utility power of 6th level or higher with the argent falcon feat power.

power.title: Argent Falcon
power.fluff: Your familiar briefly transforms into a silver falcon, and shines with pure moonlight

section.name: Effect:
section.text: Until the end of your next turn, your familiar sheds bright light in its space and each square within 3 squares of it. Enemies within the light grant combat advantage.

feat.title: Armor Endurance Training
feat.benefit: You ignore the check penalty to Strength- and Constitution-based skills for wearing armor with all armors you are proficient in.

feat.title: Armor Nimbleness Training
feat.benefit: You ignore the check penalty to Dexterity-based skills for wearing armor with all armors you are proficient in.

feat.title: Armor Proficiency (Chainmail)
feat.benefit: You gain proficiency with chainmail armor.

feat.title: Armor Proficiency (Hide)
feat.benefit: You gain proficiency with hide armor.

feat.title: Armor Proficiency (Leather)
feat.benefit: You gain proficiency with leather armor.

feat.title: Armor Proficiency (Plate)
feat.benefit: You gain proficiency with plate armor.

feat.title: Armor Proficiency (Scale)
feat.benefit: You gain proficiency with scale armor.

feat.title: Armor Snag
feat.benefit: You've learned to use your armor and shield to injure any opponent foolish enough to grab you.

When wearing plate armor you are proficient with or wielding a shield you are proficient with, a creature takes damage equal to 2 + one-half your level when you escape that creature's grab or when that creature escapes your grab. A creature can take damage from this only once per turn.
A creature that swallows you or uses a similar ability takes this damage at the end of its turn as long as you remain swallowed or similarly held.

feat.title: Astral Fire
feat.benefit: You gain a +1 bonus to damage with powers that have the Fire or Radiant keyword.
This bonus increases to +2 at 11th level, and to +3 at 21st level.

feat.title: Astral Heritage
feat.benefit: You gain the astral splendor utility power.
Also, you gain a +2 bonus to Perception checks and Insight checks against angels, devas, devils, and rakshasas.

power.title: Astral Splendor
power.fluff: You take on an imperious aspect, and silvery light -that of your astral soul- shines from your eyes, mouth, and heart

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must not be bloodied.

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You enter the Astral Splendor stance.
While you remain in the stance, enemies take a -2 penalty to attack rolls made against you.
Also, you shed bright light within 6 squares, and dim light within a further 3 squares.

section.name: Special:
section.text: This stance immediately ends if you become bloodied.

feat.title: Audacious Crow
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to Thievery checks.
This bonus increases by +1 for each member of your Team within 10 squares who is trained in Thievery or has this feat. The maximum total bonus from this feat is +5.

feat.title: Awakened Potential
feat.benefit: You gain the Psionic Augmentation class feature and 1 power point.
You can spend this power point to augment powers, feats, or magic items that are Augmentable. Once you spend this power point, you do not regain it until you take an extended rest.
You also qualify for feats that require the Psionic Augmentation class feature.
You gain an additional power point at 21st level.
feat.special: When you take this feat, choose Ardent, Battlemind, or Psion. This feat counts as a multiclass feat for that class.

feat.title: Axe Expertise
feat.benefit: When you make a Weapon attack with an axe, you can reroll one [W] of damage, or 2[W] for a daily attack. You must use the second result.
The number of [W] you can reroll increases to 3[W] for a daily attack at 11th level, and to 2[W] for all attacks and 5[W] for a daily attacks at 21st level.

feat.title: Axe Strike
feat.benefit: When you miss a target with a Weapon attack using an Axe you have proficiency with and would deal no damage to it, you can expend your power strike class power.

If you do, instead of the power's normal effects, you deal damage equal to your Strength modifier + your weapon's enhancement bonus. For each +[W] past the first the power would normally deal, this damage increases by +2.

feat.title: Bardic Dilettante
feat.benefit: You gain training in one skill from the Bard's class skill list.
You can use the Bard's majestic word as a daily power once per day.
In addition, you gain proficiency in bard implements.

feat.title: Bardic Ritualist
feat.benefit: You gain training in the Arcana skill.
You gain the Bard class' Bardic Training class feature.
In addition, you gain proficiency in bard implements.

feat.title: Battering Shield
feat.benefit: When you are wielding a heavy shield and push or slide a target with a melee attack, you can move that target 1 additional square.

feat.title: Battle Awareness
feat.benefit: You gain training in one skill from the Fighter's class skill list.

Once per encounter, when an enemy that is adjacent to you shifts or makes an attack that does not include you as a target, you can make a melee basic attack against that enemy as an immediate interrupt.

feat.title: Battle Berserker
feat.benefit: You gain training in one skill from the Barbarian's class skill list.
You also gain the Savage Rage class feature, but can only enter a Rage once per day.

feat.title: Battle Caster Defense
feat.benefit: You gain a +4 bonus to AC against reactive strikes when using a ranged or an area power.

feat.title: Battle Hardened
feat.benefit: You gain a +5 feat bonus to saving throws against Fear effects.
In addition, you gain a +2 feat bonus to Initiative checks.

feat.title: Battle Trample
feat.benefit: You gain the battle trample power.

power.title: Battle Trample
power.fluff: You incite your mount to stamp, read, and kick unpredictably, with any foe that remains too close taking damage and being driven back

section.name: Target:
section.target: a mount you are riding and that has a trample power

section.name: Effect:
section.text: Until the start of your next turn, any enemy that ends its turn adjacent to the target takes 3 damage, and is pushed 1 square from the target. The effect ends if you are no longer riding the target.

section.name: Mount Level 11:
section.text: 6 damage.

section.name: Mount Level 21:
section.text: 9 damage, and pushed 2 squares.

feat.title: Battlewise
feat.benefit: You can use your Wisdom modifier instead of your Dexterity modifier when you make an Initiative check.

feat.title: Beguiling Enchantment
feat.benefit: Whenever you hit an enemy with a Charm power, that enemy takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls against you until the end of its next turn.

feat.title: Beneath Notice
feat.benefit: When you and an ally are adjacent to the same enemy that is larger than both of you, you gain combat advantage against that enemy.

feat.title: Bestial Stability
feat.benefit: When you and your beast companion are adjacent to each other, you can either increase or decrease the distance of any forced movement movement against either you or your companion (but not both at once) by 2 squares.
Also, while adjacenet to your companion, you can stand from prone as a minor action.
Finally, when your beast companion is adjacent to you and would be knocked prone, you can attempt a saving throw to keep it standing.

feat.title: Betrayal of Body
feat.benefit: While you are suffering ongoing damage that lacks a type, you can transfer the ongoing damage to one ally adjacent to you as a free action. You can do this only once per round.
When you transfer the ongoing damage, its damage increases by 5.

feat.title: Binding Initiate
feat.benefit: You gain training in one skill from the Binder Warlock's class skill list.
You also gain proficiency with rods and wands.
In addition, you choose one binder pact. You gain both the at-will attack and the utility power it grants at 1st level as encounter powers.

feat.title: Binding Ritual Mastery
feat.benefit: When interacting with creatures that have an origin other than natural, you can use Arcana or Religion in place of Diplomacy and Intimidate, and gain a +2 bonus to such checks.
Once per day, you can ignore the component cost of a binding ritual of your level or lower that you cast.

feat.title: Blade Initiate
feat.benefit: You gain training in the Arcana skill.
You also gain the initiate's warding power. This power counts as the Swordmage Warding class feature for the purposes of qualifying for feats, etc.
In addition, you gain proficiency in swordmage implements.

power.title: Initiate's Warding
power.fluff: You have studied the warding techniques of swordmages, but cannot reach the reliability expected of them

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must be wielding a light blade or a heavy blade

section.name: Effect:
section.text: Until the end of the encounter, you gain a +1 bonus to AC, or a +3 bonus to AC if one hand is free.
You lose the bonus if you are no longer wielding a light blade or heavy blade, and regain it when you again wield one. The effect immediately ends if you fall unconscious.

feat.title: Blade Opportunist
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls for triggered attacks you make with a heavy blade or a light blade.

feat.title: Blade of Faith
feat.benefit: You gain training in one skill from the Avenger's class skill list.
Also, you gain the initiate's oath class power. This counts as the Avenger's oath of enmity class power and you count as having the Oath of Enmity class feature.
In addition, you gain proficiency with Avenger implements.

power.title: Initiate's Oath
power.fluff: You focus your wrath on a single foe, giving an attack against it extraordinary accuracy

section.name: Target:
section.target: one enemy you can see in range

section.name: Effect:
section.text: The target becomes your oath target until you hit the target or until the target drops to 0 hit points or fewer, whichever comes first.

feat.title: Blind-Fighting Sentinel
feat.benefit: Invisible or hidden enemies do not gain combat advantage against you while within 5 squares of you.
Also, you do not take the normal -10 penalty to Perception checks while blinded.
In addition, you gain a +2 feat bonus to Perception checks.

feat.title: Blind-Fighting Warrior
feat.benefit: You ignore concealment and total concealment on melee attacks.

feat.title: Blood's Passion
feat.benefit: Choose a power granted by the Ardent Mantle class feature. You can use that power as a daily power.

feat.title: Bloodied Concentration
feat.benefit: While you are bloodied, you gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls with augmented at-will psionic attack powers.

feat.title: Bloodied Fleetness
feat.benefit: While you are bloodied, you gain a +1 bonus to speed.
Beginning at 11th level, while you are bloodied, you also gain a +1 bonus to any movement from a power that does not count your speed.

feat.title: Bloodied Spear
feat.benefit: You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls when making triggered Weapon attacks.
The bonus to damage rolls increases to +2 at 11th level, and to +3 at 21st level.
Both bonuses increase by +1 for each member of your team within 10 squares that is either bloodied or has this feat, to a maximum increase of +5.

feat.title: Bloodthirsty Mien
feat.benefit: Whenever you score a critical hit, you gain a +5 bonus to Intimidate checks against creatures that could see or hear you. This bonus lasts until the end of the encounter, then becomes a +2 bonus until the end of the day.

feat.title: Blowgun Training
feat.benefit: You gain proficiency with the blowgun.
Also, you can reload a blowgun as a free action, increase its range to 10/20, and treat it as having the High Crit property.
If you are a Rogue, you can use a blowgun with the Sneak Attack class feature and any Rogue powers that normally requires you to wield a crossbow or sling.
In addition, if you miss an attack with a blowgun and are hidden from each target, you can remain hidden despite making an attack.
Finally, you can learn the following powers as multiclass powers of the indicated level:

power.title: Stinging Shot
power.fluff: The needle lodges in a sensitive area, jolting your prey with pain

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must be wielding a blowgun

section.name: Attack:
section.text: Dexterity vs. Reflex

section.name: Hit:
section.text: 2[W] + Dexterity modifier damage, and the target is dazed until the end of your next turn.

section.name: Level 17:
section.text: If you know this power as an encounter power of level 17 or higher, the damage increases to 4[W] + Dexterity modifier.

section.name: Miss:
section.text: The target grants combat advantage until the end of your next turn.

power.title: Uncanny Blowgun Aim
power.fluff: You breathe precisely, taking in your target and carefully lining up the needle's trajectory

section.name: Effect:
section.text: Your next attack with a blowgun gain a +2 bonus to the attack roll. If the attack imparts an effect that a save can end, the target takes a -3 penalty to its first saving throw against it.

power.title: Crippling Needle
power.fluff: Your needle lodges in a key pressure point, causing your target to stiffen and momentarily fail to act

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must be wielding a blowgun

section.name: Attack:
section.text: Dexterity vs. AC

section.name: Hit:
section.text: 3[W] + Dexterity modifier damage, and the target is stunned until the end of its next turn.

section.name: Aftereffect:
section.text: The target is dazed (save ends).

section.name: Level 25:
section.text: If you know this power as a daily attack power of 25th level or higher, the damage increases to 5[W] + Dexterity modifier.

section.name: Miss:
section.text: Half damage, and the target is dazed (save ends).

feat.title: Bludgeon Expertise
feat.benefit: When wielding a hammer or mace, you gain a +1 feat bonus to the number of squares you can push or slide creatures with Weapon attacks.
This increases to +2 at 21st level.
In addition, if you cannot push or slide a target the full distance because of blocking terrain, the target takes damage equal to your Strength modifier + your weapon's enhancement bonus.
This damage increases to 4 + your Strength modifier + your weapon's enhancement bonus at 11th level, and to 8 + your Strength modifier + your weapon's enhancement bonus at 21st level.

feat.title: Bola Training
feat.benefit: You gain proficiency with the bola.
When you make a Weapon attack with your bola and hit, you can forgo dealing damage to the target to immobilize it until the end of your next turn. On a critical hit, the target is also knocked prone.
In addition, you can learn the following powers as multiclass powers of the indicated level:

power.title: Binding Bola
power.fluff: The weights entwine the cords around your target, wrapping it so tightly that it cannot maintain its momentum

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must be wielding a bola

section.name: Attack:
section.text: Dexterity vs. Reflex

section.name: Hit:
section.text: 2[W] + Dexterity modifier damage, and the target is immobilized until the end of your next turn.

section.name: Critical:
section.text: The target is also knocked prone.

section.name: Level 17:
section.text: If you know this power as an encounter attack power of 17th level or higher, the damage increases to 4[W] + Dexterity.

power.title: Bola Recovery
power.fluff: With the bola back in hand, you ready it for another precise throw

section.name: Prerequisite:
section.text: You must know the binding bola power

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must be wielding a bola

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You regain the use of your binding bola power.

power.title: Felling Bola
power.fluff: Such is the force of your throw, that your foe is knocked down it finds too painful stand back up again

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must be wielding a bola

section.name: Attack:
section.text: Dexterity vs. Reflex

section.name: Hit:
section.text: 2[W] + Dexterity modifier + Strength modifier damage and the target is knocked prone.
The target cannot stand up from prone (save ends).

section.name: Level 25:
section.text: If you know this power as a daily attack power of 25th level or higher, the damage increases to 5[W] + Dexterity modifier + Strength modifier.

section.name: Miss:
section.text: Half damage, and the target is knocked prone.
The target cannot stand from prone until the end of its next turn.

feat.title: Bolstering Recovery
feat.benefit: When you spend one or more healing surges, you gain 5 temporary hit points in addition to any other benefits of spending that healing surge. If spending the healing surge grants you temporary hit points, instead increase the number gained by this amount.
These temporary hit points increase to 10 at 11th level, and to 15 at 21st level.

feat.title: Boon of the Made
feat.benefit: When you use your elan resilience power, you also gain resistance to all damage equal to your Intelligence modifier until the start of the triggering enemy's next turn.
This resistance increases to 3 + your Intelligence modifier at 21st level.

feat.title: Born of Shadows
feat.benefit: Your origin changes to shadow, making you considered an shadow creature for all purposes instead of your previous creature origin, such as natural or fey.
Also, you gain a +2 feat bonus to Stealth
In addition, you gain a +1 bonus to saving throws while in dim light or darkness.

feat.title: Born of the Elements
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to Endurance and Intimidate checks.
In addition, you can speak, read and write primordial.

feat.title: Bow Expertise
feat.benefit: You gain a +1 bonus to Weapon damage rolls with a bow when you attack a single target that is not adjacent to any creatures.
The damage bonus increases to +2 at 11th level, and to +3 at 21st level.

feat.title: Bravo
feat.benefit: You gain training in Intimidate.
Once per encounter, you can designate one creature you can see as your prey until the end of the encounter. If your prey is a solo creature, this is (save ends).
You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and Intimidate checks against your prey.
This bonus increases to +2 when your prey is under a Fear effect from you.
In addition, you can learn the following powers as multiclass powers of the indicated level:

power.title: Death's Messenger
power.fluff: Your prey has an appointment with death, and your attack reminds it of the fact

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You target your prey with an at-will melee or ranged attack

section.name: Effect:
section.text: The triggering attack deals +1[W] additional damage, or +1d8 additional damage if the attack is not a Weapon attack.
On a hit, the target also takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls against you until the end of your next turn.

section.name: Level 17:
section.text: If you know this power as an encounter attack power of 17th level or higher, the additional damage increases to +2[W], or +2d8 if the attack is not a Weapon attack.

power.title: Brutal Instincts
power.fluff: With your defiant snarl, the advantage your foes had evaporates, giving you an opening

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: Any creatures flank you, or your prey gains combat advantage against you

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You do not grant combat advantage to the triggering creature or creatures until the end of your next turn.
If your prey was among those who triggered this power, you gain combat advantage against your prey until the end of your next turn.

power.title: Bravo's Finish
power.fluff: If your vicious assault doesn't bring your prey down, it is rattled to its core

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You hit your prey with an at-will attack

section.name: Effect:
section.text: The triggering attack deals +1[W] damage, or +1d8 damage if it is not a Weapon attack, and your prey is dazed (save ends).

section.name: Aftereffect:
section.text: The target grants combat advantage (save ends).

section.name: Level 25:
section.text: If you know this power as a daily attack power of 25th level or higher, the triggering attack deals +4[W] damage, or +4d8 damage if it is not a Weapon attack.

feat.title: Building Camaraderie
feat.benefit: When you succeed on a Diplomacy check, you gain a +1 bonus to Diplomacy checks until the end of the encounter. This bonus is cumulative with itself.
When you fail a Diplomacy check or a Bluff check, attempt an Intimidate check, or perform any hostile action, you lose any bonus from this feat and cannot gain the bonus again during this encounter.

feat.title: Burning Blizzard
feat.benefit: You gain a +1 bonus to damage with powers that have the Acid or Cold keyword.
This bonus increases to +2 at 11th level, and to +3 at 21st level.

feat.title: Careful Summoner
feat.benefit: Creatures summoned by your powers gain a +1 bonus to all defenses.

feat.title: Cascading Rush
feat.benefit: Whenever you push a target with bull rush, you can also push one enemy adjacent to that target 1 square.
The second enemy can be adjacent to the target either before or after you resolve the bull rush.

feat.title: Cast Afar the Spirit
feat.benefit: When you switch your familiar into active mode, you can teleport it 5 squares.

feat.title: Catacomb Delver
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to Dungeoneering checks.
Also, when you take the squeeze action, you can move at full speed (instead of half speed), and take a -2 penalty to attack rolls (instead of -5).

feat.title: Child of Fire
feat.benefit: Whenever an attack bloodies you or knocks you unconscious, one enemy of your choice within 2 squares of you takes fire damage equal to your Constitution modifier.
The fire damage increases to 3 + your Constitution modifier at 11th, and to 6 + your Constitution modifier at 21st level.

feat.title: Child of Stone
feat.benefit: When you use your second wind while on an earthen or stone surface, you also gain resist 5 to all damage until the end of your next turn.
This resistance increases to 10 at 11th level, and to 15 at 21st level.

feat.title: Child of the Maelstorm
feat.benefit: Whenever you take acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage, you gain a +2 bonus to your next saving throw during this encounter.

feat.title: Child of the Sea
feat.benefit: You gain a swim speed equal to your speed.
In addition, you gain Aquatic keyword. In aquatic combat, you gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls against nonaquatic creatures.

feat.title: Child of Wind
feat.benefit: Whenever you run or charge and are not wearing heavy armor, you ignore difficult terrain.

feat.title: Cold Adaptation
feat.benefit: You gain resist cold equal to one-half your level (minimum 1).

feat.title: Combat Intuition
feat.benefit: Whenever you miss an enemy with a melee attack, you gain a +2 bonus to triggered attack rolls against that enemy until the start of your next turn.

feat.title: Combat Reflexes
feat.benefit: You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls on reactive strikes.
Starting at 11th level, this bonus applies to all triggered attack instead.

feat.title: Connected
feat.benefit: When you make a Streetwise check, you can roll twice and take the higher result.

feat.title: Coordinated Explosion
feat.benefit: When you use an Implement power that has a burst or blast area and targets either all enemies or all creatures in the area, you gain a +1 bonus to all attack rolls with the power if at least one ally is within the burst or blast.
An ally in the area can use an immediate interrupt to increase this bonus to +2 against one enemy adjacent that ally.

feat.title: Corrupting Attacks
feat.benefit: Whenever you hit a creature with an encounter or daily attack power, that creature takes a -1 penalty to one defense the attack targeted. The penalty lasts until the end of your next turn.
If you have the Student of the Plague feat, increase the penalty to -2.

feat.title: Courageous Example
feat.benefit: Whenever you succeed on a saving throw to end an effect, the next ally to make a saving throw within 5 squares of you before the start of your next turn gains a +4 bonus to that saving throw.

feat.title: Courageous Heart
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to saving throws against Charm effects and Fear effects.
This bonus increases by +1 for each member of your Team within 10 squares who is bloodied or has this feat, to a maximum of +5.

feat.title: Covenant Eye
feat.benefit: As a free action, you can expend your use of Channel Divinity to regain the use of your evil eye of the Vistani bloodline power.

feat.title: Creation Mastery
feat.benefit: Three times per day, you can perform a ritual on half the normal time if that ritual normally requires between 1 minute and 24 hours to perform.
Also, you can perform the enchant magic item ritual as if your level was two higher.
In addition, if you have the Alchemist feat, you can make alchemical items as if your level was two higher.

feat.title: Crossbow Expertise
feat.benefit: You ignore partial cover and superior cover with Weapon attacks you make with a crossbow.

feat.title: Crusader's Fury
feat.benefit: While you are adjacent to a bloodied ally, your reactive strikes deal extra damage equal to your Charisma modifier.

feat.title: Cunning Stalker
feat.benefit: You gain combat advantage against an adjacent enemy when it is the only creature adjacent to you and you are the only creature adjacent to it.

feat.title: Cutthroat
feat.benefit: You gain training in the Stealth skill.
Also, you can use a minor action instead of a standard action to make a Bluff check to create a diversion to hide.
In addition, you can learn the following powers as multiclass powers of the indicated level:

power.title: Sudden Retaliation
power.fluff: Faster than the eye can follow, you retaliate against those attacking you or your allies

section.name: Prerequisite:
section.text: You must have training in the Intimidate skill

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: An enemy targets you or an ally

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You make an at-will melee or ranged attack against the triggering enemy. On a hit, the enemy takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls until the start of its next turn.

section.name: Level 17:
section.text: If you know this power as an encounter attack power of 17th level or higher, the attack you make deals an additional +1[W] damage, or an additional +1d8 if it is not a Weapon attack.

power.title: Cutthroat's Scrutiny
power.fluff: Studying your opponent, you search for a weakness you can take advantage of

section.name: Effect:
section.text: The target grants combat advantage to you until the end of your next turn.
Until the end of the encounter, while you have combat advantage against the target, you can score a critical hit against it on a natural roll of 19 or 20.

power.title: Quick Kill
power.fluff: You slip from the shadows unseen, striking before the enemy knows what happened

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You hit with a creature that cannot sense your current location with an at-will melee or ranged attack

section.name: Effect:
section.text: The triggering attack deals an additional +2[W] damage, or an additional +2d8 damage if it is not a Weapon attack.

section.name: Level 25:
section.text: If you know this power as a daily attack power of 25th level or higher, the triggering attack deals an additional +6[W] or +6d8 damage instead.

feat.title: Cyclone Warrior
feat.benefit: You gain training in one skill from the Fighter's class skill list.

Once per encounter as a free action on your turn, you can gain a +1 bonus to melee and close Weapon damage rolls until the end of your current turn. You must be wielding two melee weapons and wearing chainmail, light armor or no armor to gain this benefit.
This damage bonus increases to +2 at 11th level, and to +3 at 21st level.

feat.title: Dark Fury
feat.benefit: You gain a +1 bonus to damage rolls with powers that have the Necrotic or Psychic keyword.
This bonus increases to +2 at 11th level, and to +3 at 21st level.

feat.title: Darren Gambler
feat.benefit: When you reroll an attack roll, a skill check, or an ability check, you can choose to use this feat.
If you do, you gain a +2 bonus to the roll. However, if the second result is less than the first, you grant combat advantage to all attackers until the end of your next turn.

feat.title: Deadeye Slinger
feat.benefit: You treat slings as having a +3 proficiency, and the High Crit weapon property.

feat.title: Deadly Draw
feat.benefit: Whenever you pull or slide an enemy to a square adjacent to you, you gain combat advantage against that enemy until the end of your next turn.

feat.title: Deception Mastery
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to Bluff checks.
Also, when you would normally make a skill check or use a skill check modifier as part of a deception ritual, you can use Bluff instead of the indicated skill.
In addition, once per day, you can ignore the component cost of a deception ritual of your level or lower that you have mastered.

feat.title: Deepminer
feat.benefit: You can now speak, read, and write deep speech.
Also, you gain resist 3 necrotic.
This resist increases to 5 at 11th level, and to 10 at 21st level.

feat.title: Deep Sage
feat.benefit: You gain a +5 feat bonus to Dungeoneering knowledge checks to identify aberrant creatures.
Also, you can now speak, read, and write deep speech.

feat.title: Defender of the Wild
feat.benefit: You gain training in one skill from the Warden's class skill list.
Once per encounter as a free action on your turn, you can mark each enemy adjacent to you until the end of your next turn.

feat.title: Defensive Mobility
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 bonus to AC against reactive strikes.

feat.title: Defiling Action
feat.benefit: When you spend an action point to use an at-will or encounter arcane attack power, you can use your arcane defiling with that power.

feat.title: Demanding Talent
feat.benefit: You gain training in one skill from the Battlemind's class skill list.
Also, you can use the battlemind's demand class power as an encounter power, but the mark only lasts until the end of your next turn.

feat.title: Desire for Freedom
feat.benefit: You gain a +5 feat bonus to checks you make as part of the escape action.
Also, if you are immobilized, slowed, or restrained by an effect that a save can end, you can make a saving throw against that effect at the start of your turn as well as at the end of your turn.

feat.title: Directed Bull Rush
feat.benefit: When you hit a target with a bull rush, you can choose to slide that target rather than push it.
When you score a critical hit with a bull rush, you increase the maximum distance of the push by 1 square.

feat.title: Disciple of Divine Wrath
feat.benefit: You gain training in the Religion skill.
Also, you gain the Avenger's oath of enmity class power as an encounter power. The effect lasts until the end of your next turn.
In addition, you gain proficiency in Avenger implements.

feat.title: Disciplined Talent
feat.benefit: You gain training in one skill from the Psion's class skill list.
Also, you gain your choice of one 1st-level Psion at-will attack as an encounter attack. You cannot augment this power.
In addition, you gain proficiency with Psion implements.

feat.title: Distant Advantage
feat.benefit: You gain combat advantage for ranged attacks and area attacks against any enemy flanked by your allies.

feat.title: Distracting Feint
feat.benefit: When you make a Bluff check to gain combat advantage and succeed, the enemy also grants combat advantage to your allies.

feat.title: Divination Mastery
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to initiative checks.
Also, you can master and perform divination rituals as if your level were four higher.
Once per day, you can ignore the component cost of a divination ritual of your level or lower that you have mastered.

feat.title: Divine Channeler
feat.benefit: Choose a divine class other than your own, and a Channel Divinity power available as a class feature for that class.

If you don't already have the Channel Divinity class feature, you can use the selected power once per day and are treated as having the Channel Divinity feature for the purpose of meeting prerequisites. If you gain additional Channel Divinity powers, you can use them in place of the power granted by this feat, but can only use one Channel Divinity power per day.
If you already have the Channel Divinity class feature, add the selected power to your list of available Channel Divinity powers.
feat.special: This feat counts as a multiclass feat for the chosen class.

feat.title: Divine Healer
feat.benefit: You gain the Cleric class feature Healer's Lore.
Also, you gain training in the Heal skill.
In addition, you gain proficiency in Cleric implements.

feat.title: Divine Secretkeeper
feat.benefit: You gain the Invoker's Ritual Casting class feature.
Also, you gain training in the Arcana, History or Religion skill.
In addition, you gain proficiency in Invoker implements.

feat.title: Dungeon Experience
feat.benefit: You can use your Dungeoneering check modifier in place of your Thievery check modifier to disable traps and to open locks.

feat.title: Durable
feat.benefit: Your number of healing surges increases by two.
Starting at 21st level, the number increases by three instead.

feat.title: Dusk Eyes
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to Stealth checks.
Also, you gain low-light vision.

feat.title: Duty's Virtue
feat.benefit: Once per round, you can use the aid defense action as a minor action when the chosen ally for that action is bloodied.
Also, you gain a +2 feat bonus to initiative checks.

feat.title: Eager Advance
feat.benefit: You gain a +4 feat bonus to speed during the first round of an encounter (and the surprise round, if you are allowed to act during it).

feat.title: Echoes of Thunder
feat.benefit: When you hit with a Thunder attack, you gain a +1 bonus to damage rolls until the end of your next turn.
This bonus increases to +2 at 11th level, and to +3 at 21st level.

feat.title: Elan Heritage
feat.benefit: You have undergone the rite of Awakening to strip away imperfections in your physical form, becoming an elan.
Your origin changes to immortal, making you considered an immortal creature for all purposes instead of your previous creature origin, such as natural or fey.
Also, you gain telepathy 5.
For every two additional feats from this bloodline you have, the range of your telepathy increases by 1.
In addition, you gain the elan resilience power.

power.title: Elan Resilience
power.fluff: Psionic energy flares around you, limiting the effect of an attack

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You take damage.

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You reduce the triggering damage by your Intelligence modifier.

section.name: Level 11:
section.text: By 3 + your Intelligence modifier.

section.name: Level 21:
section.text: By 6 + your Intelligence modifier.

feat.title: Elemental Companion

prereq.name: must not have the Arcane Familiar feat

feat.benefit: You gain an elemental companion.
For each elemental companion feat you have beyond this one, your elemental companion gains a +1 bonus to all defenses.

feat.title: Elemental Conduit
feat.benefit: While your elemental companion is in passive mode, you gain a +2 power bonus to Insight checks and Perception checks.
Also, you gain the elemental conduit power.

power.title: Elemental Conduit
power.fluff: Chaos from your elemental companion twists space so that the two of you can swap positions

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: Your elemental companion must be in active mode.

section.name: Target:
section.target: you, and your elemental companion in the burst

section.name: Effect:
section.text: Each target teleports, swapping positions.

feat.title: Elemental Invigoration
feat.benefit: When you spend a healing surge while your elemental companion is in active mode, you and each ally adjacent to the companion gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls until the end of his or her next turn.
This damage bonus increases to +3 at 11th level, and to +4 at 21st level.

feat.title: Elemental Sailor
feat.benefit: You can speak, read and write primordial.
Also, you gain a +2 bonus to Acrobatics and Athletics checks made while aboard a ship.
In addition, when you make an Athletics check to climb while aboard a ship, you climb at your normal speed rather than half speed.

feat.title: Elemental Vengeance
feat.benefit: While your elemental companion is in active mode, you gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls against bloodied creatures that are adjacent to the companion.
Also, you gain the elemental vengeance power.

power.title: Elemental Vengeance
power.fluff: A burst of scintillating color erupts from your destroyed companion, distracting your enemies

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: Your active elemental companion is destroyed

section.name: Target:
section.range: burst 1, using your Elemental Companion's last space as the point of origin

section.name: Effect:
section.text: Each target grants combat advantage until the end of its next turn.

feat.title: Enduring Mountain
feat.benefit: Whenever you spend a healing surge to regain hit points, you regain 2 additional hit points, plus 1 additional hit point for each member of your Team within 10 squares of you who has this feat or is trained in Endurance.
These additional hit points increase to 3 at 11th level, and to 4 and to 2 for each Team member at 21st level.

feat.title: Escape Artist
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to Acrobatics checks.
Also, when you use the escape action, you can do so as a minor action.

feat.title: Executioner of Undeath
feat.benefit: Whenever you make a Weapon attack using an axe or a heavy blade against an undead creature, you can reroll any damage die but must use the second result.

feat.title: Expert Bloodletting
feat.benefit: Whenever you bloody and enemy with an attack, that enemy takes an additional +4 damage from the attack.
This additional damage increases to +8 at 11th level, and to +12 at 21st level.

feat.title: Expert Ritualist
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 bonus to skill checks you make as part of a ritual.

feat.title: Expert Trample
feat.benefit: When you are riding your mount, it gains a +4 bonus to AC against attacks triggered by using a trample power or similar ability.
Your mount also gains a +2 bonus to AC against attacks triggered by entering an enemy's space in other ways.

feat.title: Exploration Mastery
feat.benefit: When you make an Endurance check that is not made to determine a disease's stage change, you can use your Arcana check modifier, Nature check modifier, or Religion check modifier in place of your Endurance check modifier.
Also, once per day, you can ignore the component cost of an exploration ritual of your level or lower that you have mastered.

feat.title: Eye of Paranoia
feat.benefit: A target affected by your evil eye cannot use triggered attacks.

feat.title: Familiar's Vitality
feat.benefit: If your familiar is within 10 squares of you when you use your second wind, you regain 3 additional hit points.
These additional hit points increase to 5 at 11th level, and to 7 at 21st level.

feat.title: Fangs of the Ancient Forest
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to damage rolls with Beast Form powers if you can assume a Beast Form.
Your animal companion gains a +2 feat bonus to damage rolls if you have an animal companion.
This damage bonuses increase to +3 at 11th level, and to +4 at 21st level.

feat.title: Far Shot
feat.benefit: When you use a ranged weapon with the Load Free or Load Minor property, you increase the normal range by 5 squares and the long range by 10 squares.

feat.title: Far Throw
feat.benefit: When you use a thrown weapon, you increase the normal range by 2 squares and the long range by 4 squares.

feat.title: Fast Runner
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 bonus to speed when you charge or run.

feat.title: Fearsome Host
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to Intimidate checks.
This bonus increases by +1 for each member of your Team within 10 squares who is trained in Intimidate or has this feat. The maximum total bonus from this feat is +5.

feat.title: Feign Injury
feat.benefit: Whenever you are bloodied and succeed in a Bluff check to gain combat advantage, you can slide the target 1 square.

feat.title: Feign Weakness
feat.benefit: When you use your second wind on your turn, choose one or two enemies that can see you. The chosen enemies grant combat advantage to you until the end of your next turn.

feat.title: Fervent Talent
feat.benefit: You gain training in one skill from the Ardent's class skill list.
Also, you can use the Ardent's ardent surge class power as a daily power once per day.

feat.title: Fey Bond
feat.benefit: Through your knowledge and experience of the fey, you have gained some of their qualities; you gain a +2 feat bonus to Bluff checks and Diplomacy checks.
Also, you can read, speak and write Elven. If you can already read, speak and write Elven, you can instead read, speak and write Sylvan.

feat.title: Fey Cantrip
feat.benefit: Choose one at-will power available as part of the Wizard class's Cantrips class feature. You gain that power.

feat.title: Fey Senses
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to Perception checks.
Also, you gain a +2 bonus to saving throws against Charm effects.

feat.title: Fey-Minded
feat.benefit: You can use Nature in place of Arcana for fey-related knowledge checks.
Also, you can speak, read and write Elven. If you can already speak, read and write Elven, choose Giant, Goblin or Sylvan instead.

feat.title: Firedancer
feat.benefit: You gain resist 5 fire.
This resist increases to 10 at 11th level, and to 15 at 21st level.
If you already have resist fire, it instead increases by 5.
Also, when you use your second wind, your melee and ranged attacks deal 1d6 extra fire damage until the end of your next turn.
This extra fire damage increases to 2d6 at 11th level, and to 3d6 at 21st level.

feat.title: Firefoe of Silvanus
feat.benefit: You gain resist 5 fire.
This resist increases to 10 at 11th level, and to 15 at 21st level.
If you already have resist 5 fire, it instead increases by 5.
Also, against fire creatures, your divine attack powers and primal attack powers deal +2 additional damage.
This additional damage increases to +4 at 11th level, and to +6 at 21st level.

feat.title: Flail Expertise
feat.benefit: When you hit with a melee Weapon attack using a flail and the attack lets you slide the target, you can choose to knock the target prone instead of sliding it.

feat.title: Flail Strike
feat.benefit: When you use your power strike attack power with a Flail you have proficiency with, you can choose to reduce the additional damage the power deals by 1[W]. If your power strike deals at least +4[W], you reduce it by 2[W] instead.
If you do, you knock the target prone and the target provokes a reactive strike from you if it stands up before the start of your next turn.

feat.title: Focused Mind
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 bonus to saving throws against effects that daze, stun or knock you unconscious.

feat.title: Focused Talent
feat.benefit: Choose one focus available as part of the Discipline Focus Psion class feature.
You can use each power granted by that Discipline Focus as a daily power.

feat.title: Foulborn Heritage
feat.benefit: You are a foulborn.
Your origin changes to aberrant instead of natural.
Also, you have the unbalanced mind power.

power.title: Unbalanced Mind
power.fluff: Your connection to the Far Realm unleashes psychic pain in response to attack

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You take damage

section.name: Effect:
section.text: Until the end of your next turn, you have an Aura 1 (Psionic, Psychic).
Any creature that enters the aura or ends its turn there takes 5 psychic damage. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

section.name: Level 11:
section.text: 10 psychic damage.

section.name: Level 21:
section.text: 15 psychic damage.

feat.title: Four Winds
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to Athletics checks.
This bonus increases by +1 for each member of your Team within 10 squares who is trained in Athletics or has this feat. The maximum total bonus from this feat is +5.

feat.title: Frozen Soul
feat.benefit: You gain resist 5 cold, and a +1 bonus to Will. If you already have resist cold, increase it by +5 instead.
The resist cold increases to 10 at 11th level, and to 15 at 21st level.

feat.title: Furtive Signals
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to Bluff checks.
Also, you can communicate simple information silently with any member of your team that has line of sight to your position and either has this feat or is trained in Insight.

In addition, you can use Bluff to gain combat advantage or create a diversion to hide for one member of your team who is within 2 squares of you instead of for yourself. If the ally either also has this feat or is trained in Bluff, he or she can be within 5 squares instead.

feat.title: Garrote Training
feat.benefit: You gain proficiency with the garrote.
Also, when you use a garrote to grab a target, the target takes a -2 penalty to escape checks.
In addition, each turn that you sustain a grab with a garrote used with two hands, you have combat advantage against the target you're grabbing when attacking it with the garrote.
If you are a Rogue, you can use the garrote with your Sneak Attack class feature and any Rogue power that can be used with a Light blade.
Finally, you can learn the following powers as multiclass powers of the indicated level:

power.title: Choking Grab
power.fluff: You slip your garrote over your enemy's neck and draw the cord tight

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must be wielding a garrote.

section.name: Attack:
section.target: one creature you have combat advantage against
section.text: Chosen Ability vs. Reflex

section.name: Hit:
section.text: 2[W] + Strength modifier damage, and the target is dazed until the end of your next turn.

section.name: Level 17:
section.text: If you know this power as an encounter attack power of 17th level or higher, the damage increases to 4[W] + Strength modifier.

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You grab the target.

section.name: Special:
section.text: When you gain this power, choose whether you use Strength or Dexterity for the attack roll.

power.title: Body Shield
power.fluff: Your choking hold with the garrote allows you to manipulate your adversary into harm's way

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must be wielding a garrote, and grabbing a creature with it.

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You are targeted by a melee or ranged attack by a creature other than the creature you are grabbing

section.name: Effect:
section.text: The creature you are grabbing becomes the target for the triggering attack instead of you.

power.title: Strangler's Hold
power.fluff: With expert skill, you loop the garrote around your victim and draw tight, closing off air and sending your enemy into unconsciousness

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must be wielding a garrote.

section.name: Attack:
section.target: one creature you have combat advantage against
section.text: Chosen Ability vs. Reflex

section.name: Hit:
section.text: 4[W] + Strength modifier damage, and the target is dazed (save ends).

section.name: First Failed Saving Throw:
section.text: The is stunned (save ends) instead of dazed.

section.name: Second Failed Saving Throw:
section.text: The target is unconscious (save ends) instead of stunned.

section.name: Aftereffect:
section.text: The target is dazed until the end of its next turn.

section.name: Level 25:
section.text: If you know this power as a daily attack power of 25th level or higher, the damage increases to 6[W] + Strength modifier.
You grab the target. Each time you sustain the grab, you deal damage to the target equal to your Strength modifier + your weapon's enhancement bonus.

section.name: Level 25:
section.text: If you know this power as a daily attack power of 25th level or higher, the damage increases to 6 + your Strength modifier + your weapon's enhancement bonus.

You can choose to sustain the grab as a standard action. If you do, the target takes a penalty to its next saving throw against this effect equal to 1 + one-half your Strength modifier (minimum -2 penalty).

section.name: Miss:
section.text: The target grans combat advantage to you until the end of your next turn or until it is no longer adjacent to you, whichever comes first.
You regain the use of this power at the start of your next turn.

section.name: Special:
section.text: When you gain this power, choose whether you use Strength or Dexterity for the attack roll.

feat.title: Ghost Scorpion Strike
feat.benefit: Your Necrotic attack powers and Poison attack powers ignore the insubstantial quality.

feat.title: Giant Killer
feat.benefit: When you score a critical hit against a creature of Large or greater size, you deal an extra 1d6 critical damage.
This extra damage increases to 2d6 at 11th level, and to 3d6 at 21st level.

feat.title: Gouge Specialist
feat.benefit: You can learn the following powers instead of powers from your class at the appropriate levels.

power.title: Gouge Sweep
power.fluff: You swing your gouge in an arc, thrusting it a couple foes to knock them aside

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must be wielding a gouge

section.name: Attack:
section.text: Strength vs. AC

section.name: Hit:
section.text: 1[W] + Strength modifier damage, and you slide the target 1 square and knock it prone.

section.name: Level 17:
section.text: If you know this power as an encounter power of level 17 or higher, the damage increases to 3[W] + Strength modifier and you slide the target up to 3 squares.

power.title: Gouge Press
power.fluff: When an enemy staggers under your gouge assault, you adroitly follow

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You hit an enemy with a gouge

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You shift 3 squares to a square adjacent to the enemy.

power.title: Gouge Pin
power.fluff: With driving force, you push your enemy down and pin it to the ground with your gouge

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must be wielding a gouge.

section.name: Attack:
section.text: Strength vs. AC

section.name: Hit:
section.text: 4[W] + Strength modifier damage.

section.name: Level 25:
section.text: If you know this power as a daily power of 25th level or higher, the damage increases to 6[W] + Strength modifier.

section.name: Miss:
section.text: Half damage.

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You knock the target prone and grab it. The grab immediately ends if you attack any creature other than the target.
Until the grab ends, the target cannot stand up.

When you push, pull, or slide the target while it is grabbed by you, the grab does not end as a result of that forced movement, and you can shift your speed to a square adjacent to the target. The grab still ends if you cannot end the shift adjacent to the target.

feat.title: Grasping Magpies
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to Thievery checks.

Also, whenever an ally in your team successfully aids another your Thievery check and that ally either has this feat or has the Skill Focus feat with Thievery, you gain a +4 bonus instead of the normal +2 bonus.
In addition, if you successfully aid another the Thievery check of an ally in your team, that ally gains a +4 bonus instead of the normal +2 bonus.

feat.title: Great Fortitude
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to Fortitude.

feat.title: Grim Promise
feat.benefit: Whenever you score a critical hit against an enemy, that enemy takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls until the end of your next turn.

feat.title: Grounding Shot
feat.benefit: Your ranged attacks ignore the penalty for attacking prone targets and deal 2 extra damage against them.
This extra damage increases to 3 at 11th level, and to 4 at 21st level.

feat.title: Gythka Specialist
feat.benefit: You can learn the following powers instead of powers from your class at the appropriate levels.

power.title: Gythka Claw Swoop
power.fluff: Using the off-hand end of your gythka as a distraction, you swipe at your enemy and then dart around to deliver a more precise blow with the main end

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must be wielding a gythka.

section.name: Attack:
section.text: Strength vs. AC (off-hand end)

section.name: Hit:
section.text: 1[W] (off-hand) damage, and the target grants combat advantage to you until the end of your current turn.

section.name: Level 17:
section.text: If you know this power as an encounter power of 17th level or higher, the damage increases to 2[W].

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You can shift up to one-half your speed.

section.name: Attack:
section.text: Strength vs. AC (main end)

section.name: Hit:
section.text: 1[W] (main) + Strength modifier damage.

section.name: Level 17:
section.text: If you know this power as an encounter power of 17th level or higher, the damage increases to 2[W] + Strength modifier.

section.name: Effect:
section.text: If you did not shift the full distance before, you can shift the rest of the distance.

power.title: Gythka Parry
power.fluff: After delivering a blow, you move to a defensive position and adjust your grip to place your gythka between yourself and your enemy

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You hit an enemy with a gythka

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You shift up to one-half your speed, and gain a +2 power bonus to AC and Reflex against the triggering enemy until the end of your next turn.

power.title: Gythka Arc Slam
power.fluff: You punch your gythka into your enemy, causing it to double over in pain, and then heft the weapon up, ready to bring it crashing down if your foe tries to stand

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must be wielding a gythka.

section.name: Primary Attack:
section.text: Strength vs. AC (main end)

section.name: Hit:
section.text: 2[W] (main) + Strength modifier damamage.

section.name: Level 25:
section.text: If you know this power as a daily power of 25th level or higher, the damage increases to 3[W] + Strength modifier.
You slide the target 3 squares to a square adjacent to you and knock it prone. You can use the Gythka Arc attack once before the end of your next turn, using the same target.

section.name: Miss:
section.text: You push the target 2 squares.
You regain the use of this power at the start of your next turn.

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: The target stands up while you are wielding a gythka

section.name: Attack:
section.text: Strength vs. AC (off-hand end)

section.name: Hit:
section.text: 1[W] + Strength modifier damage, and the target cannot stand up (save ends).

section.name: Level 25:
section.text: If you know this power as a daily power of 25th level or higher, the damage increases to 2[W] + Strength modifier.

feat.title: Hafted Defense
feat.benefit: While you are wielding a polearm or staff in two hands, you gain a +1 shield bonus to AC and Reflex. You must have proficiency with the weapon to gain this bonus.

feat.title: Hammering Iron
feat.benefit: Whenever you hit a target with a reactive strike using a hammer or mace you have proficiency with, you can also push the target 1 square. If your reactive strike already pushes the target, increase the maximum distance by 1 square instead.
If you have abilities or items that allow you to increase this distance, calculate the full distance and then halve it (rounded down) for this.

feat.title: Hammering Strike
feat.benefit: When you use your power strike attack power with a Hammer or Mace you have proficiency with, you can choose to reduce the damage by +1[W]. If your power strike deals at least +4[W] additional damage, you reduce it by +2[W] instead.
If you do, you daze the target until the end of your next turn.

feat.title: Harbinger of Nature's Wrath
feat.benefit: You gain training in the Nature skill.
Also, you gain the nature's growth druid class power as a daily power.
In addition, you gain proficiency with druid implements.

feat.title: Haunting Shade
feat.benefit: Your origin changes to shadow, making you considered an shadow creature for all purposes instead of your previous creature origin, such as natural or fey.
Also, you gain a +2 feat bonus to Stealth checks.
In addition, you gain darkvision out to 5 squares. If your origin was already show or you learn any of the multiclass powers, the range limit is removed.

You can learn any of the following powers as multiclass powers of the indicated level. Choose Dexterity or Charisma when you take this feat. You use the chosen ability for attack and damage rolls with these powers.

power.title: Black Blade of Despair
power.fluff: Your form blurs, becoming a thing of smoke and darkness, and where your blade falls, death surely follows

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must be wielding either a Heavy Blade or a Light Blade.

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You become insubstantial until the end of your next turn.

section.name: Attack:
section.text: Ability vs. Reflex

section.name: Hit:
section.text: 1[W] + Ability modifier damage plus 1d6 cold and necrotic damage.

section.name: Level 17:
section.text: If you know this power as an encounter attack power of 17th level or higher, the damage increases to 2[W] + Ability modifier plus 2d6 cold and necrotic damage.

power.title: Shade Stride
power.fluff: You melt into the gloom and reappear some distance away from where you were

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You teleport 10 squares to a space containing dim light or darkness.

power.title: Gathering of Shadows
power.fluff: Dark duplicates of your weapon crawl across the ground, piercing your foes' shadows and leaving them reeling in pain before the darkness wraps around you

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must be wielding either a Heavy Blade or a Light Blade.

section.name: Attack:
section.text: Ability vs. Fortitude
You gain combat advantage if the target is in darkness

section.name: Hit:
section.text: 2[W] + Ability modifier cold and necrotic damage, and the target is dazed (save ends).

section.name: Level 25:
section.text: If you know this power as a daily attack power of 25th level or higher, the damage increases to 4[W] + Ability modifier.

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You become invisible until the end of your next turn, and can shift 1 square.
Until the end of the encounter, dim light grants you total concealment instead just concealment.

feat.title: Headman's Chop
feat.benefit: When you attack a prone target with an Axe or a Heavy Blade, you deal an additiona +2 damage.
This additional damage increases to +4 at 11th level, and to +6 at 21st level.

feat.title: Heart of the Blade
feat.benefit: You gain training in either the Athletics skill or the Endurance skill.
Also, you gain the Swordmage feature Swordbond.
In addition, you gain proficiency with Swordmage implements.

feat.title: Heat Adaptation
feat.benefit: You gain resist fire equal to one-half your level (minimum 1).

feat.title: Heavenly Heritage
feat.benefit: When you take cold damage or fire damage, you gain temporary hit points after that damage has been resolved. The temporary hit points equal your Wisdom modifier.
These temporary hit points increase to 3 + your Wisdom modifier at 11th level, and to 6 + your Wisdom modifier at 21st level.

feat.title: Heavy Armor Agility
feat.benefit: You ignore the speed penalty for wearing heavy armor.

feat.title: Heavy Blade Expertise
feat.benefit: While wielding a Heavy Blade, you gain a +2 bonus to all defenses against reactive strikes.

feat.title: Heavy Blade Strike
feat.benefit: When you reduce an enemy to 0 hit points or fewer with a Weapon attack using a Heavy Blade, you can choose to expend your power strike class power as a free reaction.

If you do, instead of the power's normal effects, you make a melee basic attack using the same weapon against a different creature. If your power strike deals at least +4[W] additional damage, your melee basic attack deals +1[W] additional damage.

feat.title: Herbalist
feat.benefit: You gain a +5 bonus to Heal checks to treat disease.
Also, when you reach 5th level, you master the brew potion ritual and can perform it without a ritual book.

feat.title: Hidden Sniper
feat.benefit: If you have total concealment against a target, you gain combat advantage against it with your ranged attacks.
Starting at 11th level, you gain this benefit even if you only have concealment.

feat.title: Holy Symbol Expertise
feat.benefit: When you make an Implement attack using a holy symbol you have proficiency with, the enemies you target with that attack cannot gain combat advantage against you until the start of your next turn.

feat.title: Impending Victory
feat.benefit: You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls with at-will powers (including basic attacks) against bloodied creatures.

feat.title: Implement Focus
feat.benefit: Choose a type of implement with which you have proficiency. You gain a +1 feat bonus to damage rolls with Implement attacks you make using the chosen implement.
This bonus increases to +2 at 11th level, and to +3 at 21st level.

feat.title: Improved Bull Rush
feat.benefit: You gain the following benefits with bull rush:
► +2 feat bonus to attack rolls.
► You can push the target 1 additional square as long as you can shift into the vacated space.
► On a critical hit, the target must succeed in a saving throw or you can knock it prone.
► Starting at 21st level, you can score a critical hit on a natural roll of 19 or 20.

feat.title: Improved Defenses
feat.benefit: You gain a +1 feat bonus to Fortitude, Reflex, and Will.

feat.title: Improved Grab
feat.benefit: You gain the following benefits with grab:
► +2 feat bonus to attack rolls.
► You do not immediately let go of a grabbed opponent when affected by a condition that prevents you from taking opportunity actions.

► On a critical hit, your hold is so strong that if you are pulled, pushed, or slid, the creature you are grabbing moves with you. If you would be moved in a way that the creature grabbed by you cannot be, you negate the remaining forced movement.
► Starting at 21st level, you can score a critical hit on a natural roll of 19 or 20.
Also, you gain a +2 feat bonus to attack rolls with drag.

feat.title: Improved Initiative
feat.benefit: You gain a +4 feat bonus to Initiative.

feat.title: Improved Second Wind
feat.benefit: When you use your second wind, you regain an additional 5 hit points.
These additional hit points regained increase to 10 at 11th level, and to 15 at 21st level.

feat.title: Initiative of the Faith
feat.benefit: You gain training in the Religion skill.
Also, you can use the Cleric's healing word as a daily power once per day.
In addition, you gain proficiency in cleric implements.

feat.title: Initiate of the Old Faith
feat.benefit: You gain training in the Nature skill.
Also, you gain the Druid's wild shape power. Choose a 1st-level Druid at-will attack power that has the Beast Form keyword. You also gain that power as an encounter power.
In addition, you gain proficiency in druid implements.

feat.title: Inner Compass
feat.benefit: You always know which way is north.
Also, when making a Dungeoneering check or a Nature check to find your way in a natural environment, you can roll twice and use either result.

feat.title: Inspiring Leader
feat.benefit: You gain training in one skill from the warlord's class skill list.
Also, once per encounter, when an ally within 5 squares of you spends an action point, that ally regains hit points equal to 1 + one-half your level.

feat.title: Iron Will
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to Will.

feat.title: Jack of All Trades
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to untrained skill checks.

feat.title: Jousting Charge
feat.benefit: If you hit a target with a charge attack while you are mounted, you can push the target 1 square and then shift 1 square into the space the target vacated.
Starting at 21st level, you can push the target 2 squares and then shift 1 square into the space the target vacates for each square of forced movement.

feat.title: Ki Focus Expertise
feat.benefit: You gain a +1 bonus to damage rolls against bloodied enemies with attacks you make using a ki focus.
The bonus to damage increases to +2 at 11th level, and to +3 at 21st level.

feat.title: Knack for Survival
feat.benefit: You gain one Wilderness Knack of your choice.
This is in addition to any Wilderness Knack you might have.

feat.title: Learned Spellcaster
feat.benefit: You gain training in the Arcana skill, the Nature skill, or the Religion skill.
Also, you gain the Wizard class feature Vast Knowledge.
In addition, you gain proficiency with Wizard implements.

feat.title: Life in the Shadows
feat.benefit: You gain darkvision with a range of 3 squares.
The range increases to 4 squares at 11th level, and to 5 squares at 21st level.

feat.title: Light Blade Expertise
feat.benefit: You gain a +1 bonus to Weapon damage rolls you make with a Light Blade against a creature granting combat advantage to you.
This bonus increases to +2 at 11th level, and to +3 at 21st level.

feat.title: Light Blade Strike
feat.benefit: When you make a melee basic attack with a Light Blade you have proficiency with, you can choose to expend your power strike attack power as a nonaction interrupt before making the attack roll.

If you do, instead of the power's normal effects, you make the triggering attack against the target's Reflex instead, and gain a +2 bonus to damage for each additional +[W] of damage the power would normally deal.

feat.title: Lightning Reflexes
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to Reflex.

feat.title: Linguist
feat.benefit: Choose three languages. You can now speak, read, and write those languages.
feat.special: You can take this feat more than once. Each time you select this feat, choose three new languages.

feat.title: Long Jumper
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to Athletics checks.
Also, you count as having a running start for all long jumbs.

feat.title: Low Crawl
feat.benefit: You can shift while prone. You shift up to half the distance you normally would, rounded down to a minimum of one.
If you have an ability that allows you to move faster while crawling, those abilities apply similarly to your shifting.

feat.title: Low-light Adaptation
feat.benefit: You gain low-light vision.

feat.title: Lucky Start
feat.benefit: If your initiative is the highest of any combatant at the start of an encounter, when you make your first attack roll of the encounter, you can roll twice and use either result.

feat.title: Mace Strike
feat.benefit: When you make an at-will Weapon attack against a target's AC using a Mace you have proficiency with, you can expend your power strike attack power before making the attack roll.

If you do, instead of the power's normal effects, you make the triggering attack against the target's Fortitude instead, and gain a +2 bonus to damage for each additional [W] of damage the power would normally deal.

feat.title: Mark of Detection
feat.benefit: When you make a Perception check, you can roll twice and use the higher result.
Also, you can sense the presence of magic as if you were trained in the Arcana skill, and can use Perception instead of Arcana for the check.

In addition, you can master and perform rituals in the divination category as if you had the Ritual Caster feat. You can also master and perform the banish illusions, eavesdropper's foil, and scry trap rituals as if you had the Ritual Caster feat.

feat.title: Mark of Finding
feat.benefit: When an enemy granting combat advantage to you is adjacent and shifts, you can shift 1 square as a free reaction.
Also, you can master and perform the detect object, detect secret doors, find the path, and inquisitive's eyes rituals as if you had the Ritual Caster feat.

feat.title: Mark of Handling
feat.benefit: You gain the benefits of the Mounted Combat feat.
While you are mounted on a natural beast, the mount gains a +2 feat bonus to speed and a +1 feat bonus to AC.
Also, if you have an animal companion, that companion gains a +2 feat bonus to speed and a +1 feat bonus to AC.
In addition, you can master and perform the animal messenger and steed summons rituals as if you had the Ritual Caster feat.

feat.title: Mark of Healing
feat.benefit: Whenever you use a Healing power on an ally, or use the Heal skill to allow an ally to use his or her second wind, that ally can also make a saving throw against a single effect that ends on a save.

Also, you can master and perform rituals in the restoration category as if you had the Ritual Caster feat. You can also master and perform the remove affliction ritual as if you had the Ritual Caster feat.

feat.title: Mark of Hospitality
feat.benefit: During a short rest, if you or an ally spends at least one healing surge to regain hit points, that character regains additional hit points during the short rest.

The additional hit points equal 1 + one-half the level of any unexpended encounter Healing powers available to characters taking the rest. For Healing powers without a level, such as healing word or ardent surge, use one-half the level of the character.
Also, you can master and perform the eye of alarm, fantastic recuperation, secure shelter, and travelers' feast rituals as if you had the Ritual Caster feat.

feat.title: Mark of Making
feat.benefit: You have mastered the enchant magic item ritual and can perform it as if you were two levels higher.
Also, you have the Alchemist feat and can create alchemical items as if you were two levels higher.
In addition, you can master and perform rituals in the creation category as well as the make whole ritual as if you had the Ritual Caster feat.

feat.title: Mark of Passage
feat.benefit: Whenever one of your powers lets you move, shift, or teleport, you can increase the distance by 1 square.

Also, you can master and perform rituals in the travel category as well as the enhance vessel, find the path, passwall, phantom steed, steed summon, and water walk rituals as if you had the Ritual Caster feat.

feat.title: Mark of Scribing
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 bonus to Diplomacy checks.
Also, choose four languages. You can speak, read, and write the chosen languages. When you gain a level, you can retrain one of these languages in addition to the normal retrain you get.
In addition, you have the Ritual Caster feat, and can create ritual scrolls in half the normal time.

feat.title: Mark of Sentinel
feat.benefit: Whenever an enemy provokes a reactive strike from you, you can shift 1 square either before or after making the attack.
Also, you can master and perform the eye of alarm, eye of warning, and magic circle rituals as if you had the Ritual Caster feat.

feat.title: Mark of Shadow
feat.benefit: Whenever you make an attack and miss every target while hidden, you remain hidden.
Also, whenever you make an attack and miss every target while invisible, you remain invisible, even if the effect normally ends when you attack.

In addition, you can master and perform rituals in the deception and scrying categories, as well as the knock, masking shroud, secret page, and shadow walk rituals as if you had the Ritual Caster feat.

feat.title: Mark of Storm
feat.benefit: Whenever you hit a creature with a Thunder or Lightning power, you can slide that creature 1 square.
Also, you gain a +1 bonus to speed when flying.
In addition, you can master and perform the endure elements, enhance vessel, summon winds, and water walk rituals as if you had the Ritual Caster feat.

feat.title: Mark of Warding
feat.benefit: Whenever one of your powers grants a bonus to a defense, increase that bonus by 1.
Also, whenever you mark an enemy, that enemy takes a -3 penalty to attack rolls instead of the normal -2 penalty.
In addition, you can master and perform rituals in the warding category, as well as the fluid funds, knock, and Leomund's secret chest rituals as if you had the Ritual Caster feat.

feat.title: Master at Arms
feat.benefit: You can use a minor action to sheathe a weapon, and then draw a weapon.

feat.title: Master of the Fist
feat.benefit: You gain training in either Athletics or Acrobatics.
Also, you gain the Monk class feature Unarmed Combatant.
In addition, you gain proficiency with ki focuses.

feat.title: Melee Training
feat.benefit: Choose an ability score other than Strength.
When you make a melee basic attack using a weapon with which you have proficiency, you can use the chosen ability instead of Strength for the attack roll.
Also, you can use half the chosen ability's modifier, instead of your Strength modifier, for the damage roll.

feat.title: Mending Spirit
feat.benefit: You gain the Shaman class power healing spirit, but you can use it only once per encounter.

feat.title: Midnight Stalker
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to Stealth checks.
This bonus increases by +1 for each member of your team within 10 squares who has this feat or has the Skill Focus feat with Stealth, to a maximum bonus of +5.

feat.title: Mighty Crusader Expertise
feat.benefit: While you wield a two-handed melee weapon that you have proficiency with, you gain a +4 bonus to all defenses against reactive strikes triggered for making a ranged or area attack using a holy symbol you have proficiency with.

feat.title: Miss and Adapt
feat.benefit: When you make an at-will attack and miss every target, you gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls against each target until the end of your next turn.

feat.title: Monastic Adept
feat.benefit: You gain training in one skill from the Monk's class list.
Also, you choose one 1st-level monk at-will attack power. You can use that power as an encounter power.

feat.title: Monastic Disciple
feat.benefit: You gain training in one skill from the Monk's class list.
Also, you choose one of Flurry of Blows powers. You can use that power as an encounter power.
In addition, you gain proficiency with ki focuses.

feat.title: Moon Strike
feat.benefit: When you have combat advantage against an enemy, your attacks against that enemy count as silvered. Lycanthropes are one of the enemies where a silver weapon has an effect.

feat.title: Mounted Combat
feat.benefit: While you are riding a creature, it does not take the normal -2 penalty to attack rolls that is imposed on mounts.
