Also, the creature you are riding can make any Athletics checks, Acrobatics checks, Endurance checks, or Stealth checks using your skill check modifier for the corresponding skill (not including any temporary bonuses or penalties) in place of its own.

feat.title: Multitalent
feat.benefit: You gain a +1 bonus to skills in which you have training.

feat.title: Nature's Bloom
feat.benefit: You master the bloom ritual, and can perform it without a ritual book.
Also, you can perform the ritual in 5 minutes, including during a short rest and performing the ritual does not prevent you from resting.

In addition, if a creature takes a short rest in the rituals area while you perform it, that creature heals additional hit points for each healing surge spent to regain hit points as part of that rest. These additional hit points equal 2 + one-half your Wisdom modifier.
In addition, you can perform the bloom ritual once per day without paying its component cost.

feat.title: Net Training
feat.benefit: You gain proficiency with the net.
Also, when you make a Weapon attack using a net and hit, the target is also slowed until the end of your next turn.
In addition, you can learn the following powers as multiclass powers.

power.title: Net Sweep
power.fluff: You sweep your net around, smashing your foes and battering down their weapons

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must be wielding a net.

section.name: Attack:
section.text: Strength vs. Fortitude

section.name: Hit:
section.text: 1[W] + Strength modifier damage, and the target is battered until the end of your next turn.

section.name: Level 17:
section.text: If you know this power as an encounter attack power of 17th level or higher, the damage is 2[W] + Strength modifier, and the power gains the following miss entry:

section.name: Miss:
section.text: The target takes a -2 penalty to the first attack roll it makes before the end of your next turn.
While battered, the target is slowed and takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls.

power.title: Net Shield
power.fluff: You sping your net around to foil your enemies' attacks

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must be wielding a net.

section.name: Effect:
section.text: Until the start of your next turn or until you are not longer wielding a net, you gain a +2 power bonus to AC and Reflex defense.

power.title: Net Trap
power.fluff: You fling the net so that it falls over yuour enemy and, the more the foe struggles, the tighter the net's grasp becomes

section.name: Requirements:
section.text: You must be wielding a net.

section.name: Attack:
section.text: Strength vs. Reflex

section.name: Hit:
section.text: 2[W] + Strength modifier damage, and the target is caught in your net (until escape).

section.name: Level 25:
section.text: If you know this power as a daily attack power of 25th level or higher, the damage increases to 4[W] + your Strength modifier.

While the target is caught, it is grabbed by you and takes a -5 penalty to both attack rolls and rolls made to escape the grab. You can sustain the grab as a minor action while the target remains within 5 squares of you.

section.name: Aftereffect:
section.text: The target is slowed until the start of its next turn.
While you have the target caught, you cannot use your net to attack. The effect ends if you move more than 5 squares away from it.

If the target would be pushed, pulled, or slid more than 5 squares away from you, you can attempt a saving throw. On a success, you stop the forced movement so that the target is 5 squares away from you.

section.name: Miss:
section.text: Half damage, and the target is caught in the net until the end of its next turn or until it escapes, whichever comes first.

feat.title: Nimble Blade
feat.benefit: When you attack with a Light Blade and you have combat advantage against the target, you gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls.

feat.title: Nimble Runner
feat.benefit: When you run, you gain a +2 bonus to Reflex until the start of your next turn, and running doesn't cause you to grant combat advantage.

feat.title: Noble Indoctrination
feat.benefit: You gain training in Religion.
Also, you gain the righteous judgement attack power.
In addition, you can learn the following powers as multiclass powers of the indicated level.

These Implement powers are simple yet effective. You use your highest ability for attack and damage rolls, and can use a weapon you have proficiency with as if you had implement proficiency with it. You do not count as having implement proficiency with the weapon for any other purposes.

power.title: Righteous Judgement
power.fluff: You whisper a bitter prayer, condemning your enemy to Bahamut's judgement

section.name: Attack:
section.text: Ability vs. Will

section.name: Hit:
section.text: Both of the following benefits can be used once before the end of your next turn:
If the target willingly moves, one ally within 5 squares of you can shift 2 squares as an immediate reaction.
If the target makes an attack, one ally within 5 squares of you gains a +2 power bonus to attack rolls and a +2 power bonus to damage rolls against the target until the end of his or her next turn.

section.name: Level 11:
section.text: +3 power bonus to damage rolls.

section.name: Level 21:
section.text: +4 power bonus to damage rolls.

power.title: Hand of Justice
power.fluff: A divine draconic claw appears and punishes your enemy for attacking a friend

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: An enemy within range that you can see hits an ally with an attack

section.name: Effect:
section.text: The target takes damage equal to 3 + your ability modifier + your implement's enhancement bonus, and the triggering ally can spend a healing surge to regain hit points equal to his or her healing surge value.

section.name: Level 17:
section.text: If you know this power as an encounter attack power of 17th level or higher, the damage increases to 9 + your ability modifier + your implement's enhancement bonus.

power.title: Righteous Savior
power.fluff: You rush to your endangered ally's side to lend divine aid where it's most needed

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: An ally within 5 squares of you is hit by an attack

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You shift up to 5 squares to a space adjacent to the triggering ally, and the ally gains a +2 bonus to all defenses until the start of the currently acting creature's next turn.

power.title: Shining Purpose
power.fluff: Your vision reveals a path towards victory, allowing an ally to shrug off injuries and and seize the moment

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You hit an enemy

section.name: Target:
section.target: one ally you can see in the burst

section.name: Effect:
section.text: The target ally can spend a healing surge to regain hit points equal to his or her healing surge value, and then make a basic attack against the triggering enemy with a +2 power bonus to the attack roll as a free reaction. His or her attack has the Radiant keyword and it deals an extra +2d10 radiant damage.

section.name: Level 25:
section.text: If you know this power as a daily attack power of 25th level or higher, the ally's attack deals an extra +4d10 radiant damage.

feat.title: Oncoming Storm
feat.benefit: When you hit with a Lightning attack power, you gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls with Thunder powers until the end of your next turn.

feat.title: Opportunistic Shielding
feat.benefit: When you hit with a reactive strike while you're using a shield, one ally adjacent to you gains a +2 bonus to AC and Reflex until the start of the triggering creature's next turn.

feat.title: Opportunistic Shove
feat.benefit: When you make a reactive strike, you can make a bull rush instead of a melee basic attack. If you do and hit, the target also grants combat advantage until the start of its next turn.

feat.title: Orb Expertise
feat.benefit: You gain a +1 bonus to the number of squares you pull, push or slide a a target when using an orb implement.

feat.title: Orienting Teleport
feat.benefit: Whenever you willingly teleport, you can choose to stand from prone or drop prone as part of the teleportation.

feat.title: Pact Initiate
feat.benefit: You gain training in one skill from the warlock's class skill list.

Also, you must choose one of the Elritch Pacts. You gain your choice of one 1st-level at-will attack power that you would have had to choose as part of having the pact. You can use the chosen power as an encounter power.
In addition, you gain implement proficiency with rods and wands.

feat.title: Pernicious Onslaught
feat.benefit: When a creature fails a saving throw against ongoing damage from one of your attacks, one creature adjacent to it takes fire and necrotic damage equal to that ongoing damage.
If you have the Student of the Plage feat, the fire and necrotic damage equals the ongoing damage plus 5.

feat.title: Persistent Ambusher
feat.benefit: When you miss an enemy granting combat advantage to you with an encounter attack power, the first ally that hits the enemy before the start of your next turn deals +2 additional damage.
This additional damage increases to +4 at 11th level, and to +6 at 21st level.

feat.title: Persistent Spirit
feat.benefit: When your familiar is destroyed, an echo of its spirit remains. Treat your familiar as in its active state until the end of your next turn, at which time the spirit fades away.

feat.title: Pick Expertise
feat.benefit: You gain a +1 bonus to Weapon damage rolls against targets that have a size category larger than yours.
This bonus to damage increases to +2 at 11th level, and to +3 at 21st level.

feat.title: Pick Strike
feat.benefit: When you use your power strike class power with a Pick, you deal maximum damage on a natural roll of 18 to 19.

feat.title: Platinum Revelation
feat.benefit: You gain training in the Insight skill.
Also, you gain the Bahamut's shield attack power.
In addition, you can learn the following powers as multiclass powers of the appropriate levels. You use your highest ability modifier for the attack roll and damage roll.

power.title: Bahamut's Shield
power.fluff: You invoke the Platinum Dragon to shield yourself and others from harm

section.name: Attack:
section.text: Ability vs. AC

section.name: Hit:
section.text: 1[W] + Ability modifier damage, and the target takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls until the start of your next turn.

section.name: Level 21:
section.text: 2[W] + Ability modifier damage.

section.name: Miss:
section.text: The target takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls with the first attack it makes before the start of your next turn.

power.title: Dragon's Rebuke
power.fluff: Your strike awakens the dragon within you, giving you the drive to punish your foe should it fail to give your god his proper due

section.name: Attack:
section.text: Ability vs. AC

section.name: Hit:
section.text: 2[W] + Ability modifier damage.

section.name: Level 17:
section.text: If you know this power as an encounter attack power of 17th level or higher, the damage increases to 4[W] + Ability modifier.

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You can use the following attack action at-will until the start of your next turn. This action does not have the Weapon keyword.

section.name: Opportunity Reaction:
section.text: Trigger: The target makes an attack that does not include as a target; You push the target 2 squares.

section.name: Level 17:
section.text: If you know this power as an encounter attack power of 17th level or higher, the maximum distance you can push the target increases to 4 squares.

power.title: Zealous Fury
power.fluff: When an enemy dishonors you by attacking an ally, you intercede to ensure your enemy does not make the same mistake twice

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: An ally within 10 squares of you is hit by an enemy's attack

section.name: Effect:
section.text: The target regains hit points equal to his or her healing surge value. If the target has abilities that activate on spending a healing surge to regain hit points, those abilities can trigger from this power.
You teleport adjacent to the triggering enemy, and mark that enemy (save ends).

power.title: Righteous Intolerance
power.fluff: Filled with righteous fury, you unleash divine wrath to penetrate your opponent's defenses

section.name: Attack:
section.text: Ability vs. AC

section.name: Hit:
section.text: 2[W] + Ability modifier radiant damage.

section.name: Level 25:
section.text: If you know this power as a daily attack power of 25th level or higher, the radiant damage increases to 6[W] + Ability modifier.

section.name: Miss:
section.text: Half damage.

section.name: Effect:
section.text: Bahamut's divine fury radiates from the target (save ends).

While it radiates, when an ally within 3 squares of the target takes damage, that ally gains temporary hit points equal to one-half your level after the damaging effect has been resolved. You can then use a free reaction to shift your speed to a square adjacent to that ally.

section.name: Aftereffect:
section.text: The target is dazed until the end of its next turn.

feat.title: Poison Adaptation
feat.benefit: You gain resist poison equal to one-half your level (minimum 1).
If you already resist poison, you instead increase that resist by 5.

feat.title: Poison Inured
feat.benefit: You gain a feat bonus to saving throws against Poison effects. The bonus equals your Constitution modifier.

feat.title: Poisoner
feat.benefit: You gain training in the Thievery skill.
Also, your attacks ignore the first 5 points the target's resist poison.
This increases to ingoring the first 10 points at 11th level, and to the first 15 points at 21st level.
In addition, you treat a creature that is immune to poison as having resist poison equal to 15 + one-half its level.
In addition, you can learn the following powers as multiclass powers of the indicated level:

power.title: Improvised Poison
power.fluff: In your experience with toxins, there's always something on hand to make an attack venomous

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You use an at-will melee or at-will ranged attack on your turn

section.name: Effect:
section.text: The triggering power gains the Poison keyword. If the power deals typed damage, you can choose to change all typed damage to poison. If you do, the power loses the corresponding damage keyword.
The first target you hit with the triggering power takes ongoing 5 poison damage (save ends) and grants combat advantage until the end of its next turn.

section.name: Special:
section.text: If the triggering attack misses all targets, you regain the use of this power at the start of your next turn.

power.title: Potent Poison
power.fluff: Your poisons have an insidious effectiveness

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You miss an attack roll with a Poison power

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You reroll the triggering attack roll.

power.title: Progressive Poison
power.fluff: You imbue your attack with a withering poison that diminishes your foe more the longer the poison acts

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You use an at-will melee or at-will ranged attack

section.name: Effect:
section.text: The triggering power gains the Poison keyword. If the power deals typed damage, you can choose to change all typed damage to poison. If you do, the power loses the corresponding damage keyword.
The first target you hit with the triggering power is affected by your progressive poison (save ends).
While affected, the target takes ongoing 10 poison damage, and has a -2 penalty to attack rolls.

section.name: Aftereffect:
section.text: Ongoing 5 poison damage (save ends).

section.name: First Failed Saving Throw:
section.text: While affected, the target is blinded instead of taking a -2 penalty to attack rolls.

section.name: Second Failed Saving Throw:
section.text: While affected, the target is also weakened.

section.name: Level 25:
section.text: If you know this power as a daily attack power of 25th level or higher, the ongoing poison damage increases to 20, and the aftereffect ongoing poison damage increases to 10.

section.name: Special:
section.text: If the triggering attack misses all targets, you regain the use of this power at the start of your next turn.

feat.title: Polearm Expertise
feat.benefit: While you are wielding a two-handed Polearm that you have proficiency with in two hands, you gain a +2 bonus to all defenses against charge attacks, and other attacks where the attacker moves to you from further away as part of the attack.

feat.title: Polearm Flanker
feat.benefit: When you make a melee Weapon attack with a Polearm that you have proficiency with against a target that is not adjacent to you, choose an unoccupied square that is adjacent to both you and the target. You are considered to occupy that square for the purpose of determining if you flank the target when resolving the attack.

feat.title: Power Attack
feat.benefit: When making a melee Weapon attack, you can take a -2 penalty to the attack roll.
If you do, you gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll per [W] of damage, or a +4 bonus if you make the attack with a weapon wielded in two hands.
feat.special: Your DM can allow you to use this with non-Weapon attacks as well, such as those flavored as done with your body or a shield.

feat.title: Power Throw
feat.benefit: When making a ranged Weapon attack with a Heavy Thrown weapon, you can choose to take a -2 penalty to the attack roll.
If you do, you gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll per [W] of damage.
feat.special: Your DM can allow you to use this with non-Weapon attacks as well, if the flavour of the attack fits.

feat.title: Powerful Charge
feat.benefit: When you charge, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls as part of that charge, and a +2 bonus to attack rolls when making a bull rush as part of that charge.
The bonus to damage increases to +3 at 11th level, and to +4 at 21st level.

feat.title: Primal Sharpshooter
feat.benefit: You gain training in the Nature skill.
Also, you gain the Seeker class power inevitable shot as a daily power. Unlike the normal class power, you do not regain the use of this when you spend an action point.
In addition, choose one 1st-level Seeker at-will attack power. You gain that power as an encounter power.

feat.title: Protected Mind
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to saving throws against effects that daze, stun, or dominate you, as well as ongoing psychic damage.
Also, when you succeed on a saving throw to end one of these effects, you can shift 1 square as a free reaction and gain a +2 bonus to Will until the start of your next turn.

feat.title: Quick Draw
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to Initiative checks.
You can draw a weapon (or an object, such as a potion, stored in a belt pouch, a bandolier, or a similar container) as part of the same action used to attack with the weapon (or use the object).

feat.title: Quick Familiar
feat.benefit: Once per turn, you can move your familiar as a minor action instead of a move action.

feat.title: Radiant Fortification
feat.benefit: When you hit with a Radiant power, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier.
These temporary hit points increase to 3 + your Constitution modifier at 11th level, and to 6 + your Constitution modifier at 21st level.

feat.title: Raging Storm
feat.benefit: You gain a +1 bonus to damage with powers that have the Lightning keyword or the Thunder keyword.
This bonus to damage increases to +2 at 11th level, and to +3 at 21st level.

feat.title: Rapid Assault
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with melee attacks until the end of your first turn (after the surprise round, if any).
This bonus to damage increases to +4 at 11th level, and to +6 at 21st level.

feat.title: Ravenous Blessing
feat.benefit: Whenever you target an ally with a Healing power, you can choose to take necrotic damage equal to 3 + one-half your level. This damage cannot be decreased in any way.
If you choose to take the damage, one ally of that Healing power regains additional hit points equal to your level.
If you have the Student of the Plague feat, an ally who regains hit points from this feat also gains a +2 power bonus to saving throws until the end of your next turn.

feat.title: Ready for Battle
feat.benefit: During your first turn in every encounter, you gain a +1 bonus to the first Weapon attack roll you make and the first creature that you hit with a Weapon attack takes 2 extra damage from the attack.
The extra damage increases to +3 at 11th level, and to +4 at 21st level.

feat.title: Reaper's Blade
feat.benefit: You gain proficiency with the sickle and the scythe.
Also, you gain a +2 feat bonus to damage rolls with these two weapons.
This bonus to damage increases to +3 at 11th level, and to +4 at 21st level.
In addition, you treat the sickle as having the High Crit weapon property, and the scythe as dealing 2d6 damage.

feat.title: Resourceful Leader
feat.benefit: You gain training in one skill from the warlord's class skill list.
Also, once per encounter, when an ally within 5 squares of you spends an action point, that ally gains a +1 bonus to all defenses until the start of his or her next turn.

feat.title: Restoration Mastery
feat.benefit: You gain the following benefits when you administer first aid:
► When you allow the target to use his or her second wind, he or she gains the bonus to defense from the action.

► When you aid a target with an effect that a save can end, the target gains a +2 bonus if he or she saves immediately, or increases the bonus to +5 if he or she chooses to gain a bonus to the next saving throw.
Also, you can marter and perform restoration rituals as if your level were two higher.

feat.title: Righteous Fury
feat.benefit: When you make a melee basic attack on your turn, you can choose to take a -2 penalty to the attack roll.

If you do, the attack gains the Fear keyword, and the target takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls until the end of your next turn if you hit, or a -2 penalty to the first attack roll it makes before the end of your next turn if you miss.

feat.title: Rising Chaos
feat.benefit: Whenever you take acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls until the end of your next turn.
This bonus to damage increases to +3 at 11th level, and to +4 at 21st level.

feat.title: Ritual Caster
feat.benefit: You can master and perform rituals of your level or lower. See the full rules for rituals for more information.
feat.special: Some rituals use the Heal skill or the Nature skill, but they cannot be used to qualify for this feat.
Many classes grant this feat without having to meet the prerequisites.

feat.title: Rod Expertise
feat.benefit: When you wield a rod you have proficiency with, you gain a +1 shield bonus to AC and Reflex.

feat.title: Roof Runners
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to Athletics checks.

Also, when an ally in your team successfully aids another your Athletics check and that ally has this feat or has the Skill Focus feat with Athletics, you gain a +4 bonus instead of the normal +2 bonus.

In addition, an ally in your team who has this feat or is trained in Athletics can attempt to aid another your Athletics check as part of taking the same type of action. For example, an ally could aid your attempt to make a long jump my making a similar jump.

feat.title: Ruthless Efficiency
feat.benefit: You gain training in the Stealth skill.
Also, you gain the Ruthless Ruffian class feature of the Rogue, including proficiencies with the club and mace, and the bonus to damage with rogue Fear powers.

feat.title: Scrappy
feat.benefit: You gain the bonus to damage when wielding a Versatile weapon two-handed.
When you wield a Small and Versatile weapon two-handed, you instead gain an additional +1 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.
This additional damage bonus increases to +2 at 11th level, and to +3 at 21st level.

feat.title: Scrying Mastery
feat.benefit: Whenever you make an Arcana check, Insight check, or Perception check as part of a scrying ritual, you can roll twice and use the higher result.
Also, the DC to sense a scrying sensor you created increases by 5.
In addition, once per day, once per day you can ignore the component cost of a scrying ritual of your level or lower that you have mastered.

feat.title: See the Next One Coming
feat.benefit: When a creature that is flanking you hits you with an attack, you do not grant combat advantage for being flanked until the start of the currently acting creature's next turn. You still count as flanked for other purposes.

feat.title: Serene Archery
feat.benefit: When you make a ranged basic attack using a Bow with which you have proficiency, you can use Wisdom instead of Dexterity for the attack roll and the damage roll.

feat.title: Shadow Blood
feat.benefit: When you use your second wind and are in an area of dim light or darkness, you regain 5 additional hit points.
These additional hit points increase to 10 at 11th level, and to 15 at 21st level.

feat.title: Shadow Control
feat.benefit: You gain a +1 feat bonus to all defenses while you are in dim light or darkness.

feat.title: Shadow Initiate
feat.benefit: You gain training in the Stealth skill.
Also, you can use the assassin's shroud assassin class power twice per encounter.
In addition, you gain proficiency with Assassin Implements.

feat.title: Shadow Mantle
feat.benefit: When you either score a critical hit or reduce a nonminion enemy to 0 hit points or fewer, you gain concealment until the end of your next turn.

feat.title: Shadow Veil
feat.benefit: When you hit an adjacent creature with an encounter attack or a daily attack, and the attack has the Illusion keyword, you can shift 1 square as a free reaction.
Starting at 21st level, this increases to shift up to 2 squares.

feat.title: Shadow of the Wild
feat.benefit: If you are hidden in an outdoor environment and you make an attack, you can make a Stealth check with a -5 penalty to remain hidden.

feat.title: Shared Speed
feat.benefit: You and your familiar each receive a +1 feat bonus to speed. If your familiar has additional movement modes, it gains this speed to all of them.

feat.title: Shield Fighting
feat.benefit: At the start of your turn, you can choose to forgo the bonus to defenses from a shield you wield.
If you do, you gain a bonus to damage rolls until the start of your next turn. The bonus equals +1 for every two [W] of damage, rounded up.

feat.title: Shield Finesse
feat.benefit: You ignore the check penalty for wielding a shield for all shields you are proficient with.

feat.title: Shield Proficiency (Heavy)
feat.benefit: You gain proficiency with heavy shields.

feat.title: Shield Proficiency (Light)
feat.benefit: You gain proficiency with light shields.

feat.title: Shielding Familiar
feat.benefit: You replace one utility power of 6th level or higher with the shielding familiar feat power.

power.title: Shielding Familiar
power.fluff: Your familiar leaps to deflect an attack, sacrificing itself to save you

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: Your familiar must be in its passive state.

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You are hit be an attack

section.name: Effect:
section.text: The triggering attack deals only half damage to you, and your familiar is destroyed.

feat.title: Shifting Defense
feat.benefit: When you use the total defense action, you can also shift 1 square.
This inscreases to shift up to 2 squares at 21st level.

feat.title: Sickening Finish
feat.benefit: Whenever you reduce an enemy to 0 hit points or fewer, you gain a +1 bonus to all defenses until the end of your next turn.

feat.title: Silent Shadows
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to Stealth checks.

Also, whenever you roll a Stealth check and dislike the result, if you are within 5 squares of a member of your team who has this feat or is trained in Stealth, you can reroll the Stealth check. Your feat bonus increases by +1 for each team member of your team with this feat within 5 squares of you, to a maximum of +5.

feat.title: Silvery Glow
feat.benefit: You gain a +1 bonus to damage with powers that have the Cold or Radiant keyword.
This bonus increases to +2 at 11th level, and to +3 at 21st level.

feat.title: Skill Focus
feat.benefit: Choose a skill in which you have training. You gain a +3 feat bonus to checks with the chosen skill.
feat.special: You can take this feat multiple times. Each time you select this feat, choose a different skill.

feat.title: Skill Power
feat.benefit: You gain a skill power of your level or lower for a skill in which you have training.
feat.special: You can take this feat a second time as a paragon feat, and a third time as an epic feat.

feat.title: Skill Training
feat.benefit: You gain training in one skill of your choice, which doesn't need to be on your class skill list.
feat.special: You can take this feat more than once. Each time you select this feat, choose a different skill.

feat.title: Skirmishing Leader
feat.benefit: When an ally within 5 squares of you spends an action point, that ally can use a free interrupt to shift 1 square before or after the effects of the action point have been resolved.

feat.title: Sling Expertise
feat.benefit: You gain a +4 bonus to all defenses against reactive strikes triggered for making a ranged or area attack using a Sling.

feat.title: Slow Fall
feat.benefit: When you fall, you reduce the falling damage by your Acrobatics check result instead of one-half your check result.

feat.title: Slow the Embrace of Death
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to death saving throws. This bonus increases by +1 for each failed death saving throw you have made.

feat.title: Sly Dodge
feat.benefit: You gain training in either the Bluff skill or the Intimidate skill.
Also, once per encounter, when an enemy makes a reactive strike against you, you can add your Charisma modifier to your AC against that attack.

feat.title: Sneak of Shadow
feat.benefit: You gain training in the Thievery skill.
Also, once per encounter, you can use the Sneak Attack rogue class feature.

feat.title: Soldier of Virtue
feat.benefit: You gain training in one skill from the paladin's class skill list.
Also, you gain proficiency with holy symbols.
In addition, you gain the virtue's touch paladin class power as a daily power.

feat.title: Soldier of the Faith
feat.benefit: You gain training in one skill from the paladin's class skill list.
Also, you gain proficiency with holy symbols.
In addition, you gain the divine challenge paladin class power as an encounter power.

feat.title: Spellplague Sense
feat.benefit: You know when you're within 5 squares of something touched by the Spellplague, such as an area affected by it, a plaguetouched creature, or a creature with a spellscar. You can sense the presence of the source, but not the direction or distance.
You also gain a +2 feat bonus to Nature checks.

feat.title: Strengthtening Second Wind
feat.benefit: When you use your second wind, you gain +3 power bonus to the first damage roll you make with a melee Weapon attack before the end of your next turn, or a +5 bonus if you are still bloodied after your second wind.
These bonuses to damage increases to +5 and +8 at 11th level, and to +8 and +12 at 21st level.

feat.title: Team Player
feat.benefit: You gain a +5 bonus to checks to aid another.
Also, when you succeed in aid another or use either aid attack or aid defense, you grant the target a +3 bonus instead of +2 bonus.

feat.title: Tormenting Imposition
feat.benefit: When an enemy fails a saving throw against an effect caused by you, you gain combat advantage on your first attack against that enemy before the end of your next turn.

feat.title: Vampiric Alacrity
feat.benefit: You gain a +1 feat bonus to speed while you are not in direct sunglight.
Also, if you hide while you are in dim light or total darkness, you do not take the -5 penalty to your Stealth check for moving more than 2 squares.

feat.title: Vampiric Heritage
feat.benefit: You gain the blood drain bloodline power. When you first take this feat, choose Strength, Constitution, or Dexterity as the ability you use for the attack rolls and damage rolls.
Also, you gain a +2 bonus to Perception checks and Insight checks to sense and recognize dhampyrs and undead.
You can learn the following powers as bloodline powers of the corresponding level.
feat.special: You are considered a vampire for the purpose of effects that relate to vampires, though not a member of the Vampire class.

power.title: Blood Drain
power.fluff: Vigor rushes through your body as you drain life energy from your victim

section.name: Attack:
section.target: one living creature you have grabbed
section.text: Ability +2 vs. Fortitude

section.name: Level 11:
section.text: Ability +4 vs. Fortitude

section.name: Level 21:
section.text: Ability +6 vs. Fortitude

section.name: Hit:
section.text: 1d4 + Ability modifier damage, and you can spend a healing surge to regain hit points equal to your healing surge value.

section.name: Crit:
section.text: The target is weakened until the end of your next turn.

section.name: Level 11:
section.text: 2d4 + Ability modifier damage.

section.name: Level 21:
section.text: 3d6 + Ability modifier damage.

power.title: Mist Form
power.fluff: Your form dissolves into an eerie, billowing mist

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You turn into a cloud of mist, and gain the following effects:
You become insubstantial.
You gain a fly speed of 8 (hover), and when you squeeze, you can fit through any opening that allows air to pass through. Squares of daylight are difficult terrain for you.
You cannot make any attacks while in this form.
This lasts until the end of your next turn.

section.name: Sustain Minor:
section.text: Your mist form persists until the end of your next turn.

power.title: Bloodied Regeneration
power.fluff: Your wounds call to your immortal blood, which surges to repair your body

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must be bloodied

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You gain regeneration equal to 2 + your Constitution modifier until the end of the encounter.
This regeneration is suppressed until the end of your next turn if you take radiant damage.

feat.title: Vistani Heritage
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 bonus to Diplomacy checks made against other Vistani, and to Streetwise checks made to gather information in a Vistani camp.
Also, you gain the evil eye of the Vistani bloodline encounter attack. Choose Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma. You use the chosen ability for the attack roll.

power.title: Evil Eye of the Vistani
power.fluff: You cast a baleful look upon your enemy, forcing it to cower before you

section.name: Attack:
section.target: one creature that can see you
section.text: Chosen ability +2 vs. Will

section.name: Level 11:
section.text: Chosen ability +4

section.name: Level 21:
section.text: Chosen ability +6

section.name: Hit:
section.text: The target is affected by your evil eye until the end of your next turn.
While affected, the target grants combat advantage to you and cannot willingly move closer to you.

feat.title: Wrathful Warrior
feat.benefit: Once per encounter when you spend a healing surge, you gain a +1 bonus to the first melee or close Weapon damage roll you make before the end of your next turn.
This bonus damage increases to +2 at 11th level, and to +3 at 21st level.

feat.title: Yuirwood Feyfriend
feat.benefit: You can speak, read, and write elven. If you already know elven, choose giant or goblin instead.
Also, you gain a +2 feat bonus to Arcana checks.
In addition, you gain a +2 bonus to saving throws against Charm effects.

feat.title: Zombie Veteran
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 bonus to Athletics checks to escape being grabbed, and additional creatures grabbing you increase the escape DC by +1 instead of +2.
When you make an at-will Weapon attack against an undead creature, you gain the following benefits:
► On a hit, any ally grabbed by the undead can attempt to escape as an opportunity reaction.
► You can score a critical hit on a natural roll of 19 or 20.
